text:
Some people have asked for the recipe to my oven-baked Bovmite chicken. As usual, I don't measure the amounts of each ingredient and tend to agak agak or eyeball the amounts. Don't forget to taste as you go along.
- brine the chicken in pink Himalayan salt and water solution. I didn't measure and just threw in a a few tablespoons to a medium mixing bowl and put the chicken in and filled up with water
- leave to brine overnight in the fridge if you can. I didn't have time as I was cooking it up in a few hours so I let it brine for 3 hours in the fridge
- pat dry the chicken
- lift the chicken skin and push in some cloves of garlic
- coat the chicken with VT's Bovmite marinade (ingredients below) and refrigerate for a few hours
- take the chicken out of fridge for 30minutes before putting into oven
- preheat oven to 180 degrees
- cover chicken with baking paper and foil and bake for 20 minutes
- take out and baste with marinade
- bake for another 20 minutes
- coat some oil onto skin and under 200 degree grill for 2-3 minutes until skin is browned or crispy to the level you prefer
- Enjoy the Oven-baked Bovmite Chicken!
.
VT's Bovmite Marinade
- Bovril
- Marmite
- Lakanto but sugar is fine if you're not doing low carb
- Shaoxing wine
- pepper
- honey because I was doing wings and somehow they just need honey
- and now the secret to a whole new level of tastiness to this dish... Kewpie mayo! Huh? Why, I hear you ask? Because it was looking at me from the fridge shelf and just because I love that @kewpieusa gives dishes a not so heavy hint of creamy flavour!
.
If anyone really needs measurements for my marinade, I am more than happy to try and pay more attention to how much of each ingredient I put in the next time I make my Bovmite Chicken... Just let me know, lovelies! 😊❤️
